questiontext.text:
Exercise

A factory produces cars over a five day period; Monday to Friday. Consider the following sets,

\(A = \{\hbox{cars produced from Monday to Friday}\}\)

\(B = \{\hbox{cars produced from Monday to Thursday}\}\)

\(D = \{\hbox{cars produced on Wednesday}\}\)

\(E = \{\hbox{cars produced on Wednesday and Thursday}\}\)

Which of the following statements are correct?

generalfeedback.text: Let \(A = \{\hbox{Mo}, \hbox{Tu}, \hbox{We}, \hbox{Th}, \hbox{Fi} \}\), \(B = \{\hbox{Mo}, \hbox{Tu}, \hbox{We}, \hbox{Th} \}\), \(D = \{\hbox{We}\}\) and \(E = \{\hbox{We}, \hbox{Th} \}\), then \(D \subset E \subset B \subset A\). Note that \(E \subset A\) because \(E \subset B\) and \(B \subset A\).
